content: *when i first spotted this designer bag i thought i can make that myself and so i did what started as a playful challenge soon turned into a joyful process of experimenting crocheting steaming shaping and finally adding a personal message across the top now i m sharing it with you as a free pattern and step-by-step video tutorials on youtube i created videos for each section so you can follow along at your own pace * **finished measurements after blocking ** width 39 cm 15 5 hight 41 cm 16 25 handle width 4/3 cm 0 75 handle length 74/60 cm 29 25 /23 75 **yarn ** 4 skeins of kremke soul wool papyrus 100% paper 153 m/100g 167 25yards/3 5 oz 500m 547 yds my samples are crochet in colorway rust and red **needles ** us4/3 5 mm circular or straight needles **blocked gauge ** 17 sts x 8 row = 4-inches 10cm in 1 single_crochet+ 1 chain mesh-pattern with us4/3 5 mm needles or needle size to obtain gauge **notions ** 2 stitch markers aluminum wire 2m 4mm 2 25 yd 0 15 fine pliers or similar tool to bend and cut the wire **construction notes ** the chloé tote bag is worked in the round bottom up the bottom is later crocheted together to finish and handles are added finally a wire lettering is wound with yarn and fixed atop the bag
